title: Density - radius of container from depth and mass

content.question: A cylindrical container is filled with water of density <math alttext="1000 kilograms per cubic meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math> to a depth of <math alttext="0.05 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.05</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. If the container holds <math alttext="0.40 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> of water, the radius of the container is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0.05 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.05</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.01 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.01</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.008 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.008</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.0004 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0004</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.05 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.05</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
